business.headline: Sensex jumps 500 points: What's driving today's stock market rallyBy mid-morning, the S&P BSE Sensex had gained 474.63 points to 82,504.61, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 161.90 points to 25,309.65. Most other indices across sectors also saw healthy gains, reflecting broad-based buying.

Is Goldman Sachs planning to cut jobs? Check hereGoldman Sachs is gearing up for another round of layoffs as it speeds up its shift towards artificial intelligence under its OneGS 3.0 strategy, mention reports.

Diwali Picks 2025: How can you build your portfolio this festive season As markets steady ahead of Diwali, analysts say the current calm could be the base for the next rally — a chance to quietly build wealth before the noise returns.

Q2 earnings lift IT stocks, but should investors join the rally?Experts suggest that while the IT sector looks promising in the short term, investors should take a cautious approach and focus on selective stocks that show consistent growth potential.
Sensex opens over 200 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; NTPC up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 322.86 points to 82,352.84, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 105.50 points to 25,250.55 as oif 9:35 am.

LG Electronics IPO rocks NSE, and so does LG's Korean MD with his speechLG Electronics India's Korean Managing Director, Hong Ju Jeon, won hearts across India when he addressed the audience entirely in Hindi at the company's listing ceremony.

EPFO eases withdrawal rules, but there is a catch. Details HereThe EPFO has made a big change by allowing members to withdraw their entire provident fund balance. Still, the revised rules include a major catch that not everyone may find favourable.

No proof Sunjay Kapur drafted will: Karisma Kapoor's kids call Priya acute gamblerIn the ongoing Sunjay Kapur property dispute, senior advocate Mahesh Jethmalani, representing actor Karisma Kapoor's children, slammed the late industralist's widow, Priya Kapur, calling her an "acute gambler" and saying there was no proof whether Sunjay Kapur had actually drafted the will.

Diwali 2025: Expert lists best sectors to light up your long-term portfolioOnce seen as a risky bet for the daring few, it's now finding a place right beside traditional investments. From young professionals buying their first mutual fund to families creating demat accounts, the shift is real and growing.

Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; LG Electronics listing lights up D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 297.07 points to close at 82,029.98, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 81.85 points to settle at 25,145.50.

India proving doubters wrong with its economic reforms: IMF chiefSpeaking ahead of the IMF-World Bank annual meetings in Washington, Georgieva said India's strong economic policies and reforms have helped it stand out as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Forget stocks, why should you track gold and silver rally this DiwaliWith markets showing uncertainty, should investors consider precious metals over stocks this festive season? Experts explain.
LG Electronics IPO sees bumper listing. Why you shouldn't sell entire stake todayLG Electronics IPO surged over 50% on listing, but should investors sell everything today or hold for bigger gains?

Digital finance isn't foolproof, cautions Zerodha's Nithin KamathFrom Aadhaar e-Sign to mobile apps, digital finance has transformed access to financial services in India. However, Nithin Kamath points out that system failures and delays still pose challenges for users.

Bira 91 went poof! And the name change was just the beer headWhile several news reports said that a change in the name of Indian beer Bira 91 spelt doom for the craft beer brand, it was just the tip of the iceberg. The company is facing a Rs 80-crore loss, supply-chain disruption, and most importantly, internal unrest, with employees demanding the ouster of founder Ankur Jain. This is what industry insiders have to say about the mess at Bira 91.

EPFO now allows 100% PF withdrawal. 7 major changes you should knowMembers of EPFO can now breathe a sigh of relief as the organisation allows full withdrawal of PF balances. Here's a look at seven important changes that will affect how you access your funds.

LG Electronics IPO makes bumper debut. Should you hold or sell?With the stock listing at a sharp premium, booking partial profits allows investors to secure immediate gains, while retaining a portion of shares could help benefit from the company's long-term growth trajectory.
Tata Motors shares crash 40%: Is the Tata stock really down?Tata Motors shares opened at Rs 399 on Tuesday, down around 39.62% from Monday's close of Rs 660.90.

LG Electronics lights up Dalal Street with 50% listing gain on market debutLG Electronics stock market listing: The strong opening reflected robust investor demand and optimism about the company's growth prospects in India's consumer electronics market.
Sensex jumps over 200 points, Nifty above 25,300; HCLTech up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 205.08 points to 82,532.13, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 60.60 points to 25,287.95 as of 9:30 am.

entertainment.headline: Pakistan's youth swipe right and conservatives lose sleep over Lazawal Ishq 'Lazawal Ishq', Pakistan's first online dating show, has sparked a culture clash, pitting a modern, digital generation against old-school morality.

Ahead of baby's arrival, Alia Bhatt sends gifts to mother-to-be Parineeti Chopra Actor Alia Bhatt sent a special hamper to her colleague Parineeti Chopra, who is expecting her first child. Parineeti expressed gratitude and excitement on social media.

Breaking the beat: When dancers get the Bollywood act right They started with rhythm in their veins, not scripts in their hands. Today, they're proving that the dance floor can be a gateway to stardom. The story explores how stars like Raghav Juyal, Nora Fatehi, and others have emerged as global icons.

Priyamani on reuniting for The Family Man 3, working with Manoj Bajpayee and SRK In an exclusive conversation with India Today, actor Priyamani shared her excitement about returning for 'The Family Man' Season 3. She highlighted the strong chemistry with Manoj Bajpayee and unique experiences working with Shah Rukh Khan.

Prasoon Joshi receives MP govt's National Kishore Kumar Award, expresses gratitude Lyricist Prasoon Joshi expressed gratitude after being honoured with Madhya Pradesh government's National Kishore Kumar Award.

Shweta Tripathi performs Ganga aarti amid Mirzapur: The Movie shoot in Benaras Actress Shweta Tripathi performed Ganga aarti at a Benaras ghat while shooting for Mirzapur: The Movie. The emotional moment underscores her longstanding personal and professional ties with the city.

Smriti Irani reacts to Kyunki 2 being pitted against Rupali Ganguly's Anupamaa Smriti Irani breaks her silence on the 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' vs 'Anupamaa' TRP race, saying her iconic show's legacy is beyond competition. Reflecting on 25 years of the show and its unmatched success, the actor-turned-politician praises Ekta Kapoor for creating a legend.

Send Help trailer: Rachel McAdams, Dylan O'Brien in Sam Raimi's horror comedy The trailer for 'Send Help' shows Rachel McAdams and Dylan O'Brien stranded after a plane crash. The film promises to mix dark comedy with survival drama, and highlight a tense power struggle on a deserted island.

Kantara 2 box office Day 13: Rishab Shetty's film roars on, Rs 500 crore in sight Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' continues its unstoppable box office streak, collecting Rs 465.25 crore nett in 13 days and crossing Rs 100 crore overseas. The mythological action epic is eyeing the Rs 500 crore milestone domestically and Rs 650 crore worldwide.

Actor Siddhu Jonnalaggada condemns journalist's 'are you a womaniser' question Telugu actor Siddhu Jonnalagadda condemned a journalist's question about his personal life at a film event. The actor insisted on respect and responsibility during media engagements.

Delhi High Court rejects immediate ban on fan pages using Hrithik Roshan's photos The Delhi High Court has declined an immediate ban on fan pages using Hrithik Roshan's photos, noting that some content is non-commercial and fan-generated. The court has asked for detailed evidence on alleged infringements and scheduled the next hearing for March.

Konkona Sen Sharma feels society puts onus of work-life balance entirely on women Actor Konkona Sen Sharma shared her views on women navigating through work-life balance. She highlighted the societal expectation placed on women to manage both roles effectively.

Dulquer Salmaan's Lokah Chapter 1 OTT drop confirmed, release date to be out 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra', starring Kalyani Priyadarshan, to stream on JioHotstar soon. The OTT release is expected around October 20 across multiple languages.

Vicky Kaushal excited about 'just being a dad', calls fatherhood biggest blessing Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif are eagerly awaiting their first child, with Vicky sharing his excitement about "just being a dad." The couple, long private about their personal life, are now embracing this new chapter amid love and blessings from family and fans.

Suhana Khan and Agastya Nanda groove to Kajra Re at Diwali bash. Watch viral video Suhana Khan and Agastya Nanda were seen dancing together at Manish Malhotra's Diwali bash. A video of their performance on 'Kajra Re' drew attention online.

Katy Perry's viral response to fan proposal fuels Justin Trudeau romance talk Katy Perry's recent remarks at a London concert and viral photos with Justin Trudeau have stirred speculation about her relationship status. The singer gave a cheeky response to a fan who proposed to her with a sign mid-concert.

How Dhruv Vikram's Bison could turn out to be what Sethu was for his dad Vikram Dhruv Vikram prepares to make his mark with the intense film 'Bison: Kaalamaadan' releasing this Diwali. The film could be his breakthrough, and help him step out of his father Vikram's shadow.

Grammy-winning R&B icon D'Angelo dies at 51 after battle with cancer Grammy-winning R&B and soul singer D'Angelo, known for his soulful music and memorable collaborations, has died at 51 after battling pancreatic cancer. His family mourns the loss while celebrating the enduring legacy of his extraordinary musical contributions.

Salman Khan brings royal charm to designer Vikram Phadnis' 35-year fashion gala Salman Khan made a rare and regal appearance on the ramp for Vikram Phadnis' 35th anniversary fashion show in Mumbai. The star-studded event celebrated 'Vintage India'.

general news.headline: Bribes, caste, gangsters: Haryana Police under lens after twin cop suicidesHaryana Cop Suicide: The saga, which started with the suicide of senior IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, took a new twist this week after an assistant sub-inspector (ASI) allegedly shot himself and blamed the former of corruption.
JDU names 57 candidates in 1st Bihar list, snipes seats eyed by Chirag PaswanNitish Kumar's JDU has released first candidate list, with 57 names, for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections.

Tamil Nadu to table bill seeking ban on Hindi hoardings, movies, songs: SourcesTamil Nadu plans to table a bill today banning Hindi hoardings, boards, movies, and songs, said sources. Officials stressed the move will comply with the Constitution. BJP called it absurd and a political diversion.

Green crackers allowed on Diwali in Delhi, Supreme Court sets time limitsThe Supreme Court ordered that bursting of firecrackers will be allowed only between 6 am and 7 am, and then from 8 pm to 10 pm. It also said the sale and bursting of the green crackers will be permitted in designated locations.
Pakistan's Lal Masjid momentWill the crackdown on the Tehreek-e-Labbaik spark off a new wave of violence?

All's not well within NDA after BJP releases first Bihar listThe NDA alliance in Bihar faces internal strains as seat-sharing disputes emerge ahead of assembly elections. Key leaders like JD(U) and RLM oppose allocations favouring Chirag Paswan's party, risking alliance unity.

Indian-origin strategic expert Ashley Tellis arrested in US over top secret filesUS-India expert Ashley Tellis has been arrested for allegedly hoarding classified documents and meeting Chinese officials. The long-time adviser faces up to 10 years in prison if convicted.

For the greater good: Prashant Kishor says won't contest Bihar pollsDespite not contesting the Bihar Assembly elections, the 48-year-old former poll strategist has, however, set a 150-seat target for Jan Suraaj Party, warning that anything less would be "considered a defeat."

Breaking the beat: When dancers get the Bollywood act rightThey started with rhythm in their veins, not scripts in their hands. Today, they're proving that the dance floor can be a gateway to stardom. The story explores how stars like Raghav Juyal, Nora Fatehi, and others have emerged as global icons.

Amazon plans major layoffs, up to 15% of HR staff and more could be firedAmazon is preparing to cut up to 15 per cent of staff in its HR division as part of a broader AI-driven restructuring. While the exact number of jobs affected is unknown, the Fortune report says other departments are also in the radar.

Shehbaz Sharif's over-the-top praise for Trump earns him 'bootlicker' tagAt the Gaza Summit in Egypt, Shehbaz Sharif may have impressed Trump with his effusive praise, but the Pakistan PM also earned a flood of online mockery and the 'bootlicker' tag.

Will the Muslim factor swing Bihar election results?Bihar is heading to a high-stakes Assembly poll. Its 2.3-crore Muslim voters, who have traditionally sided with the RJD and Congress Mahagathbandhan, could shape the outcome of around 80 seats. Will Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM and Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj test the community's traditional loyalty to the Mahagathbandhan?

Pakistan's youth swipe right and conservatives lose sleep over Lazawal Ishq'Lazawal Ishq', Pakistan's first online dating show, has sparked a culture clash, pitting a modern, digital generation against old-school morality.

China's pointed a bazooka at world: Tariff-happy US now wants India's backingUS Treasury Secretary said US expects India and Europe to back Washington in countering China's dominance over rare earth supplies, calling it "China versus the world." Despite steep US tariffs on Indian goods, Bessent said global support is vital.

KBC's viral kid and the six-pocket syndrome: A mirror to modern parentingA KBC contestant's confident interruption has ignited a debate on modern parenting styles in India. Experts link this behaviour to 'Six-Pocket Syndrome,' highlighting the risks of overindulgence and entitlement among children.

Will cremate body only after late IPS officer's wife's arrest: Haryana cop's familyThe family of Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Sandeep Kumar, who died by suicide, said they'll cremate his body only after late IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's wife, Amneet Puran Kumar, is put behind bars.

New Hyundai Venue spotted and it looks drastically differentThe next-generation Hyundai Venue has been revealed undisguised, showcasing a bold new design, upgraded tech-rich interior, and advanced features ahead of its highly anticipated India debut next month.

How modern co-parents are doing it rightModern relationships are reshaping traditional norms, with many separated couples choosing co-parenting and sharing responsibilities equally to support their child's well-being.

India resumes postal services to US after two-month suspension. What changesThe services had been suspended on August 22 following an Executive Order issued by the US Administration, which withdrew the de minimis treatment for postal shipments.

Why don't you turn approver against Raj Kundra, High Court asks Shilpa ShettyThe remark was made by the Bombay High Court bench while hearing actor Shilpa Shetty's plea to temporarily suspend LOC issued against her in Rs 60-crore cheating case involving her husband Raj Kundra.

How a classroom demo helped Richard Robson trap carbon and win a Nobel PrizeAt 88, Professor Richard Robson has won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for helping create molecular scaffolds known as metal–organic frameworks — crystal-like structures so advanced they can pull water from desert air, trap carbon emissions, and clean our planet's air and water. His discovery has opened new frontiers in sustainable chemistry.

Have Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli been put on notice?After India's win against West Indies, the focus has shifted straightaway to Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's return. Ahead of the ODI series against Australia, head coach Gautam Gambhir might have just sent a subtle warning to the veteran duo.

PM Modi stays away from Trump's 'Sharm-naak' Gaza circus, Shehbaz stays stagedCongress MP Shashi Tharoor questioned whether PM Modi's absence from a historic global event was a missed opportunity for India. Yet, had Modi been pulled alongside Sharif on stage as Trump played peacemaker, it's Tharoor's party that would have been crying 'Sharm-naak'.

EPFO eases withdrawal rules, but there is a catch. Details HereThe EPFO has made a big change by allowing members to withdraw their entire provident fund balance. Still, the revised rules include a major catch that not everyone may find favourable.

Abhinav Kashyap questions Salman Khan playing a war hero in Battle of GalwanDirector Abhinav Kashyap reignited his feud with Salman Khan over the actor's role in 'Battle of Galwan'. The clash reflects on the deep personal and professional rifts within the entertainment industry.

Ahead of baby's arrival, Alia Bhatt sends gifts to mother-to-be Parineeti ChopraActor Alia Bhatt sent a special hamper to her colleague Parineeti Chopra, who is expecting her first child. Parineeti expressed gratitude and excitement on social media.

sports.headline: Might be the last chance for Australian public to see Rohit-Kohli: Pat Cummins Australia captain Pat Cummins has called the upcoming ODI series against India a special occasion, suggesting it might be the last opportunity for fans in Australia to witness Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in action.

Prithvi Shaw out for duck as Maharashtra suffer horror start in Ranji Trophy Ranji Trophy: Maharashtra suffered a horror start on the opening day of the tournament. Four of their batters fell to ducks inside the first 4 overs of the match.

Ronaldo breaks record but Hungary deny Portugal early World Cup qualification Cristiano Ronaldo set a new record for World Cup qualifying goals, but Hungary secured a late 2-2 draw, preventing Portugal from clinching a spot in next summer's tournament with two games remaining.

Don't call it a home Test just because the venue is on Indian map: Ashwin Ravinchandran Ashwin has called for fixed Test centres in India. Ashwin on his YouTube channel said that it made no sense to not have home advantage despite playing in India.

Australia heading into Ashes with their worst team since 2010: Stuart Broad Former England pacer Stuart Broad believes Australia are heading into this winter's Ashes with its 'worst' team since 2010. Broad was responding to former Australia opener David Warner's prediction that England would lose the series 4-0 down under.

Messi becomes player with most assists in international football Lionel Messi broke Neymar's world record to become the player with the most assists in international football. Overall, Messi now has 397 assists across 1,129 matches.

India women's team visits Mahakaleshwar Temple after twin World Cup losses The Indian women's cricket team visited Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple to seek blessings after consecutive three-wicket losses in their home World Cup campaign. India will aim to keep their semifinal hopes alive when they face England in Indore on October 19.
Watch: Indian team leaves for Australia for white-ball series The Indian cricket team left for Australia on October 15. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli accompanied the team at Delhi's IGI airport.

Five key takeaways after India's 2-0 series win over the West Indies India completed a 2-0 series sweep against West Indies showcasing emerging young players. The series highlighted key transition points and challenges in team strategy and player management.

Inspired by Shane Warne's wizardry, Kuldeep Yadav proves his worth in whites Kuldeep Yadav is finally receiving the consistent run in the Indian Test team that he has long deserved, after years of sporadic appearances. Through patience and relentless work on his craft—drawing inspiration from Shane Warne—he is poised to carry forward India's rich spin legacy following R. Ashwin's retirement.

India will aim to keep their semifinal hopes alive when they face England in Indore on October 19.

Through patience and relentless work on his craft—drawing inspiration from Shane Warne—he is poised to carry forward India's rich spin legacy following R. Ashwin's retirement.

Brilliant Bilal Sami helps Afghanistan thump Bangladesh by 200 runsBilal Sami starred with the ball to help Afghanistan complete their decimation of Bangladesh with a commanding 200-run victory in the third and final ODI in Abu Dhabi, sealing a 3–0 series sweep.

Have Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli been put on notice?After India's win against West Indies, the focus has shifted straightaway to Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's return. Ahead of the ODI series against Australia, head coach Gautam Gambhir might have just sent a subtle warning to the veteran duo.

Indian players scared of BCCI selectors? Rahane drops bombshell remarkIndian batter and former interim captain Ajinkya Rahane has called for radical changes to how selectors in the country's domestic cricket are appointed, saying that only recently retired first-class cricketers should be entrusted with the responsibility of picking teams.

Team fell apart mentally: Carlo Ancelotti after Brazil's shocking defeat to JapanBrazil suffered a stunning 3–2 defeat to Japan, their first-ever loss to the Asian team. The defeat exposed mental weaknesses that Ancelotti says will be lessons for the World Cup preparation.

Muthuswamy, Harmer dismantle Pakistan as South Africa eye 1–0 leadSouth African spinners Senuran Muthusamy and Simon Harmer dismantled Pakistan's lineup, sharing nine wickets as the home side managed only 167 in their second innings. South Africa, chasing a venue-record 277, reached 51/2 by stumps, with Noman Ali's late double strike keeping pressure high heading into Day 4.

Women's World Cup: Colombo rain keeps SL winless, adds to New Zealand's woesSri Lanka women vs New Zealand women: Rain forced the abandonment of the Sri Lanka vs New Zealand Women's World Cup 2025 match in Colombo. Sri Lanka posted a good total of 258/6 in the first innings before rain washed out the entire second innings.

10-year-old Atiqa Mir bosses male pack for memorable win in RMC UAE ChampionshipTen-year-old Atiqa Mir made history by becoming the first female winner in the Minimax category at the RMC UAE Championship. Her victory highlights rising talent from India and marks a significant milestone in a male-dominated sport.

India's AFC Asian Cup 2027 qualification hopes shut down with 1-2 defeat to SingaporeIndia's hopes of qualifying for the 2027 AFC Asian Cup ended with a 2-1 loss to Singapore. The defeat highlights missed chances and defensive lapses that cost India dearly in the qualifiers.

Sri Lanka posted a good total of 258/6 in the first innings before rain washed out the entire second innings.

India's AFC Asian Cup 2027 qualification hopes shut down with 1-2 defeat to SingaporeIndia's hopes of qualifying for the 2027 AFC Asian Cup ended with a 2-1 loss to Singapore. The defeat highlights missed chances and defensive lapses that cost India dearly in the qualifiers.

India rally from two goals down to draw 3–3 with Pakistan in Sultan of Johor CupThe Indian junior men's hockey team fought back from two goals down to draw 3–3 with Pakistan in a thrilling Sultan of Johor Cup match. The result highlights India's resilience but leaves the group stage wide open ahead of final fixtures.

Rajiv Shukla denies rumours of Rohit, Kohli's retirement during Australia tourBCCI Vice President Rajiv Shukla has denied rumours of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's retirements after the upcoming tour of Australia, beginning on October 19 with a three-match ODI series.

Watch: Rohit Sharma lands in Delhi, set to depart with Team India for AustraliaStar India batter Rohit Sharma has landed in Delhi ahead of the three-match Test series against Australia set to begin on October 19. Rohit will link up with the rest of his teammates, who were already in the city for the second Test against West Indies. Team India will leave for Australia from Delhi in the wee hours of October 15.
The upcoming Australia series will mark the return of both Rohit and Virat Kohli to international cricket after the duo announced its Test retirement in May early this year It will also be the first series for Rohit after stepping down from captaincy and handing over the reins to Shubman Gill.
The star opener will be eager to return with a bang as he's set to play as a player for the first time since 2021.

Teenager Pratik Maharana smashes 200m record, carries Odisha's sprinting batonFrom a chance discovery to a national junior champion, Odisha's Pratik Maharana has made heads turn. Training under Siba Mishra, former coach of Dutee Chand, the 200m sprinter — tipped to win continental medals soon — is already on the radar of top athletics academies.

Watch: Gambhir's stirring speech in West Indies dressing room after Delhi TestIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir praised West Indies' strong fightback despite their Test defeat in Delhi. He emphasised that world cricket needs West Indies and urged them to build a solid Test team for future success.

BCCI stands by Gautam Gambhir in support of Harshit Rana: Make comments responsiblyBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla has backed Gautam Gambhir amid criticism over Harshit Rana's selection for the India ODI squad. Both leaders emphasise responsible criticism to protect young players' morale and uphold team unity.

Shubman Gill will grow as a captain with Rohit and Kohli by his side: Ian BishopIan Bishop believes that Shubman Gill will be in safe hands as he embarks on his new journey as ODI captain alongwith the presence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.

Gautam Gambhir demands fast bowler friendly pitches after guelling Delhi TestIndia clinched a 2-0 series victory over West Indies, yet head coach Gautam Gambhir expressed concern regarding the Arun Jaitley Stadium surface, urging for pitches that have better support for fast bowlers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
